Reason: The 'streaming_connections_per_host' configuration in the Cassandra software project is performance-sensitive because it directly impacts the efficiency of data streaming operations. Increasing the number of streaming connections per host can lead to higher network traffic and resource utilization, potentially causing bottlenecks and impacting system performance. Conversely, decreasing the number of streaming connections per host may result in slower data transfer rates and longer processing times, affecting overall system performance as well.
